summary: Arkansas is a state in the southern United States, named after the Quapaw people. It has a variety of landscapes, from mountains to forests and lowlands. The state was admitted to the Union in 1836 and was once part of French Louisiana. Arkansas's economy relied heavily on cotton plantations and slavery. After the Civil War, it struggled economically due to its dependence on agriculture. The state had racial segregation laws until the 20th century. Today, Arkansas has a diverse economy with service industries, farming (cotton, soybeans, rice), and tourism. It is home to Walmart, the world's largest company. The capital is Little Rock.
title: Arkansas
